Description: Ostracon (?), fragment of the upper-body of a light-brown pottery vessel, the interior surface, much of which has flaked away, is covered with a brown resinous deposit, the exterior, the lower section of which is ribbed, is covered with a brown slip and remains of one line of red-painted cursive text.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (394874) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/394874)
